facts.fact: Earth is the only planet with life on it (that we know of).
facts.question: Which planet has life (that we know of)?

facts.fact: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, and Jupiter have no rings.
facts.question: Which planets have no rings?

facts.fact: Saturn has the brightest rings
facts.question: Which planet has the brightest rings?

facts.fact: Uranus and Neptune have rings, but they are dim.
facts.question: Which planet has dim rings?

facts.fact: Mercury and Venus have no moons.
facts.question: Which planet has no moons?

facts.fact: Mercury has no atmosphere (air).
facts.question: Which planet has no atmosphere?

facts.fact: Jupiter is the biggest planet in our solar system.
facts.question: What is the biggest planet in out solar system?

facts.fact: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system.
facts.question: What is the smallest planet in out solar system?

facts.fact: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune are known as gas giants because they are made of gas.
facts.question: Which planets are gas giants?

facts.fact: Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars have solid surfaces (they are "terrestrial").
facts.question: Which planets have a solid surface (terrestrial)?

facts.fact: Mercury, Earth and Mars have molten metal cores.
facts.question: Which planet has a molten metal core?

facts.fact: Uranus and Neptune are known as ice giants because there cores are made of ice
facts.question: Which planet is an ice giant (has an ice core)?

facts.fact: Venus and Uranus spin backwards. The sun rises in the west, and sets in the east.
facts.question: Which planet spins backwards?

facts.fact: Uranus rotates on its side.
facts.question: Which planet rotates sideways?

facts.fact: Neptune is the windiest planet, where wind speeds can reach 2,000 kilometers per hour.
facts.question: What is the windiest planet?

facts.fact: Mars is red because iron mineral on the surface are rusting (oxidizing).
facts.question: Which planet gets its color from iron minerals rusting (oxidizing)?

facts.fact: Mars has two moons called Phobos and Deimos.
facts.question: Which planet has two moons called Phobos and Deimos?

facts.fact: The red spot on Jupiter is a giant storm.
facts.question: Which planet has a red spot that is a giant storm?

facts.fact: Juptier has 67 known moons, the most out of all the planets.
facts.question: Which planet has 67 moons?

facts.fact: Saturn has 62 moons.
facts.question: Which planet has 62 moons?

facts.fact: The gas giants (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) are mostly made of hydrogen and helium gas.
facts.question: Which planet is made of mostly hydrogen and helium?

facts.fact: The ice giants (Uranus and Neptune) are mostly made of water, ammonia and methane.
facts.question: Which gas planet is also made of water, ammonia and methane?
